result_list.explanation: Le Baron sort. – This indicates that the Baron is exiting the stage, which fits the exit category.
Elle rentre dans le château. – This indicates that the character is entering the castle, which fits the entrance category.
Voyant approcher Gustave. – This indicates movement towards a character (Gustave), thus it fits the movement category.
AIR. De la Royale, etc. – This indicates the name of a tune, fitting the music category.
Air : Babet que t'es gentille ! – Similar to the previous, this is also a tune name indicating music.
Montval, lit. – This describes a setting, specifically a character's location (a bed) in the play.
Elle sort avec Octave. – This indicates that the character is exiting with another character (Octave), which is an exit.
Il lui serre le bout des doigts. – This describes a non-verbal interaction (holding fingers), therefore it fits the interaction category.
result_list.stgdir: Il lui serre le bout des doigts.

result_list.explanation: Montrant sa bague. – This describes an interaction with an object (showing the ring), fitting the object category.
Il fait un pas pour s'en aller et revient toujours. – This indicates movement (taking a step to leave and returning), fitting the movement category.
result_list.stgdir: Il fait un pas pour s'en aller et revient toujours.
